Class Player

java.lang.Object
  Player

public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

COPYRIGHT (C) 2005 Rob Bauer. All Rights Reserved.

Player object. Used to keep track of the current room the player is in as well as the player's vitals (like health).

Version:
1.0 2005-NOV-12
Author:
Rob Bauer

Field Summary
private  java.util.ArrayList<RoomItem> backpack
          Player's backpack.

          The player's health (0-100).
private static int MAXITEMCOUNT
          Number of items allowed in the backpack
private  Room previousroom
          Keep track of the previous room the player was in

Field Detail

currentroom

private Room currentroom
Keep track of the current room the user is in.

previousroom

private Room previousroom
Keep track of the previous room the player was in

health

private int health
The player's health (0-100). If health <= 0, then the player is dead

backpack

private java.util.ArrayList<RoomItem> backpack
Player's backpack. Can only have 3 items.

MAXITEMCOUNT

private static final int MAXITEMCOUNT
Number of items allowed in the backpack

public Player()

Method Detail

getCurrentRoom

public Room getCurrentRoom()
Find out which room the user is currently in.

Returns:
Room current room the user is in.

setCurrentRoom

public void setCurrentRoom(Room room)
Set the current room as the room the user is currently in.

Parameters:
room - Room the user is in.

getPreviousRoom

public Room getPreviousRoom()
Get the previous room the player was in. Handy for when the hag steals something.

Returns:
Room the player was previously in

setHealth

public void setHealth(int newhealth)
Set the player's health to the given value.

Parameters:
newhealth - Health to set the player to (0-100)

addHealth

public void addHealth(int add)
Add positive or negative values to the player's health value. Make sure it stays between 0 and 100.

Parameters:
add - value to add to the player's health (this can be negative)

getHealth

public int getHealth()
Return the player's current health

backpackHasRoom

public boolean backpackHasRoom()
If the backpack has room, return true. Otherwise, return false.

Returns:
true if the backpack has room

addBackpackItem

public void addBackpackItem(RoomItem item)
Add an item to the backpack

Parameters:
item - Item object to add

listContents

public java.lang.String listContents()
List backpack contents.

Returns:
a string formatted for output to the player

getBackpack

public java.util.ArrayList<RoomItem> getBackpack()
Get the contents of the player's backpack.

Returns:
array list containing the contents of the backpack

removeBackpackItem

public void removeBackpackItem(RoomItem item)
Remove an item from the player's backpack.

Parameters:
item - item to remove from the backpack

resetBackpack

public void resetBackpack()
Reset the player's backpack

randomRemoveBackpackItem

public RoomItem randomRemoveBackpackItem()
Randomly remove an item from the backpack. Seed a random number generator and then pick a (hopefully) random number in the range of the number of items in the backpack.

Returns:
item that was taken out

hasCrown

public boolean hasCrown()
Check if the player has the crown in their backpack

Returns:
boolean true if the player has the crown, otherwise false
